metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4319 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A cross-origin issue existed with "iframe" elements. This was addressed with improved tracking of security origins. This issue affected versions prior to iOS 12, watchOS 5, Safari 12, iTunes 12.9 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-source package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.22.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
